metadata.title: What‚Äôs new in Safari and WebKit

abstract.text: Learn how the latest web technologies in Safari and WebKit can help you create incredible experiences. We‚Äôll highlight different CSS features and how they work, including scroll driven animation, cross document view transitions, and anchor positioning. We‚Äôll also explore new media support across audio, video, images, and icons.

inlineContent.text: Be the hero to change that by watching the video and providing notes! It‚Äôs super easy:

abstract.text: Session notes shared by the community for the community.
Discover how you can use WebKit to effortlessly integrate web content into your SwiftUI apps. Learn how to load and display web content, communicate with webpages, and more.

Learn how Digital Credentials can enhance online identity verification flows. We‚Äôll cover how websites can integrate the Digital Credentials API to enable requesting information from IDs in Wallet. We‚Äôll also explore how apps can provide their own identity documents for online verification using the new IdentityDocumentServices framework.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Verify identity documents on the web

abstract.text: Learn how Declarative Web Push can help you deliver notifications more reliably. Find out how to build on existing standards to be more efficient and transparent by design while retaining backwards compatibility with original Web Push.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Learn more about Declarative Web Push

abstract.text: Discover the latest spatial features for the web on visionOS 26. We‚Äôll cover how to display inline 3D models with the brand new HTML model element. And we‚Äôll share powerful features, including model lighting, interactions, and animations. Learn how to embed newly supported immersive media on your web site, such as 360-degree video and Apple Immersive Video. And get a sneak peek at adding a custom environment to your web pages.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: What‚Äôs new for the spatial web

abstract.text: Learn how the WebGPU API provides safe access to GPU devices for graphics and general-purpose computation. We‚Äôll also explore the WGSL shading language to write GPU programs. And we‚Äôll dive into best practices to achieve optimal performance while using minimal power across desktop and mobile devices.
